titlestmt.titleproper: Pastor George R. Swartz Sr. marriage records 2017.014
titlestmt.author: Yingwen Huang, under supervision of John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:15:21 +0000.

did.unittitle: Pastor George R. Swartz Sr. marriage records
did.abstract: The records consist of booklets that document marriages conducted by Pastor George R. Swartz Sr. in Brooklyn, dating from 1903-1938. Swartz was the pastor of the Reformed Episcopal Grace Church (Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn) from 1903-1913 and of St. Paul's Lutheran Church (Coney Island neighborhood of Brooklyn) from 1929-1957. The marriage booklets contain detailed information about the brides and grooms and document the marriages Pastor Swartz officiated.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: George R. Swartz Sr. was born in 1877. He was a pastor of the Reformed Episcopal Grace Church at 1110 Herkimer Street in the Bedford Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn from 1903-1913 and of St. Paul's Lutheran Church in the Coney Island neighborhood of Brooklyn from 1929-1957. He passed away in 1967.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The copyright status of this collection has not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Pastor George R. Swartz Sr. marriage records, 2017.014, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The records consist of seventeen booklets that document marriages conducted by Pastor George R. Swartz Sr. (1877-1967) in Brooklyn, dating from 1903-1938. He was pastor of the Reformed Episcopal Grace Church (Bedford Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn) from 1903-1913 and of St. Paul's Lutheran Church (Coney Island neighborhood of Brooklyn) from 1929-1957. The booklets contains stubs that record the names, residences, ages, race, birthplace, father's name, and mother's name of the brides and grooms. It also records whether the bride or groom was previously married and the bride's maiden name (if divorced or widowed).
